quotes.quote: Secrets have a way of making themselves felt, even before you know there's a secret.
All secrets become deep. All secrets become dark. That's in the nature of secrets.
The secret to life is meaningless unless you discover it yourself.
The best way of keeping a secret is to pretend there isn't one.
The secret to strong security: less reliance on secrets.
Secrets bind and separate in strict accordance with who's in them .
Secrets have power, and that power diminishes when they are shared, so they are best kept and kept well. Sharing secrets, real secrets, important ones, with even one other person, will change them.
I thought about how there are two types of secrets: the kind you want to keep in, and the kind you don't dare to let out.
Secrets are made to be found out with time.
Some secrets are meant to stay secret forever.
Every virtuous act has some Dark secret in its heart; every risk we take contains a mystery that can't be solved.
A real secret is something which only one person knows.
Some secrets are better left at that as secrets.
Secrets are the kind of adventure she needs. Secrets are safe, and they do much to make you different. On the inside where it counts.
Secrets are like pregnancies hereabouts. You can hide them for a while but then they will start screaming.
Keeping secrets will always lead to unhappiness and communication is the key to love.
The first rule in keeping secrets is nothing on paper.
A secret is too little for one, enough for two, and too much for three.
The only secrets are the secrets that keep themselves.
For every secret hangs in greater fear between the speaker's mouth and hearer's ear than any peril between cup and lip.
We keep secrets from ourselves that all along we know.
The greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places.
A secret is most valuable when it remains a secret.
But some secrets are too delicious not to share.
A good friend keeps your secrets for you. A best friend helps you keep your own secrets.
Secrets are a part of life. Their mysteries make our world beautiful. Their depths inspire our hearts, intrigue our minds, and embrace our very souls.
Some secrets are like fossils and the stone has become too heavy to turn over.
There are no secrets better kept than the secrets everybody guesses.
The man who can keep a secret may be wise, but he is not half as wise as the man with no secrets to keep.
A secret remains a secret until you make someone promise never to reveal it.
